content.description: Starts left of claim jumper with two holds near the ground, then an athletic, beta intensive sequence leads into the crux jump of claim jumper, finishes the same as claim jumper.
This line starts as for Real Imagination but moves directly up the gently over-hanging face right of Missinâ€™ Nuggets and tops out respectively so.
content.location: Sit start below the large left facing side-pull with a low crimpy little side-pulley underclingy thing and a low left-ish facing sloper. Hit the sidepull and go up.

content.description:
Stand start with big, left facing holds. Reach way up to awesome big edges and jugs (or maybe a scrappy crimp for those with less reach).

Cool holds and a really nice warmup for the boulder.
content.location: Left line on the river face.

content.description: About 5ft to the left of the left start hold of Hueco Crimper is a near vertical rail in the steep roof. Start matched on this and traverse right doing odd moves to get into the Hueco Crimper, finishing for that problem.

An excellent problem with some powerful moves and a few small holds. On the far right side of the boulder as looking at it from the river.

Begin on a couple good hand holds, move left to a square hold, then up using a sloper, wavy crimp, and sharp "tooth".
content.location: This problem hadn't been sent when the Cental Washington Bouldering guide came out, and there is still another new problem or variation to this one, using the arete itself just to the right.

content.description: Wrestle your way up the furthest right side of the boulder. Start on the super chalked giant jugs, grab a decent edge out left, get on that right sided sloper, and gun for the top!
content.protection: Pads, before the sloper jugs at the top of the arete its a bit dynamic
content.location: Just a bit past the SlingBlade pullout on the opposite side of the road which can be identified from either direction by its sign with an arrow indicating curves ahead. There is a little opening in the guard railing. Don't take that trail down, instead, walk a few more feet up until you can see the boulder on your left side by the river. There is a trail that leads directly to it right there.

content.description: One of the better V6's in Leavenworth. Start on the corner of the roof with your left hand in a good slot at the lip and right under the roof in the hueco. Go straight up the arete.

Start crouched and matched in the hueco, paste your feet high, hit the big sloper, move up and left to a good edge (regular start), then slap the slopers up above, topping out. Guidebook grade is V8.

Variation: start sitting with your right hand in the hueco and your left hand on an edge. Make a tension-y, powerful move into the low start. Maybe a slightly harder V8?
content.location: Back side of the boulder, facing away from Leavenworth, in the obvious hueco in the mini-roof.

content.description: The center line up the river face of the boulder. Start with a left crimp and right sidepull, smear the feet, and pinch the brick right overhead. Some interesting gaston moves bring you to an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two. Maybe a wetsuit in early spring.
content.location: The center line on the boulder's river (west) face.
